str2: A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: From pro and ago; to lead forward; intransitively, to precede (participle, previous).
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Annulment, nullification, abrogation. From atheteo; cancellation.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(lit: not strong), (a) weak (physically, or morally), (b) infirm, sick. Strengthless.
